snippet: What information exists on how well colleges teach their students has often been hidden from view. But that may be changing — including with the use of standardized tests.
abstract: Several major organizations of colleges and universities have endorsed a call for colleges to systematically gather data about how much students improve during their college years, similar to the way in which elementary, middle and high schools collect standardized test scores for their students and make them publicly available.
lead_paragraph: What information exists on how well colleges teach their students has often been hidden from view. But that may be changing — including with the use of standardized tests.

headline.main: Trying to Find a Measure for How Well Colleges Do
